newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian OTC market edged down in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Romanian OTC market edged down in quiet trade.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter market (OTC) edged down on Friday in dull trading as big investors slipped into a wait-and-see mood, traders said.
Independent indices VAB-RASDAQ and BIG-OTC, computed by the VANGUARD and BIG brokerage houses, dropped by 1.9 and 2.54 percent respectively to 3,551.1 and 2,617.59 points.
Some operators said bearish sentiment might continue if the market was not hit by fresh news from the State Ownership Fund of sale of its stakes in OTC high-caps.
Cement makers Moldocim and Romcif closed 2,000 and 50 lei weaker at 28,500 and 1,650 respectively. A third cement maker, Romcim, ended flat at 66,000.
Oil refinery Arpechim, which accounts for around 16 percent of total market capitalisation, slumped 1,500 lei to 25,000.
Turnover slipped to 7.32 billion lei from 8.89 billion on Thursday, with 2.5 million shares traded over the day.
A similar bearish mood gripped the stock exchange on Friday, with average prices of most stocks falling and volumes on the decline.
